adjective.description: First in order of importance; main.
(of money) denoting an original sum invested or lent.
examples: the principal amount of your investment

noun.description: The person with the highest authority or most important position in an organization, institution, or group.
examples: a design consultancy whose principal is based in San Francisco

noun.description: A sum of money lent or invested, on which interest is paid.
examples: the winners are paid from the interest without even touching the principal

noun.description: A person for whom another acts as an agent or representative.
examples: stockbrokers in Tokyo act as agents rather than as principals

noun.description: The person directly responsible for a crime.
An organ stop sounding a main register of open flue pipes typically an octave above the diapason.

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin principalis first, original, from princeps, princip- first, chief.
